category.description: The category to which the usage data belongs, such as calls, SMS, or recordings.

count.description: The number of units consumed in the usage record.

price_unit.description: The currency unit in which the price is denoted, such as USD or EUR.

subresource_uris.description: Contains references to sub-resources related to the usage record.

yesterday.description: The resource URI for fetching yesterday's usage records.

all_time.description: The resource URI for fetching usage records spanning all time periods.

today.description: The resource URI for fetching today's usage records.

yearly.description: The resource URI for fetching yearly usage records.

this_month.description: The resource URI for fetching usage records for the current month.

monthly.description: The resource URI for fetching monthly usage records.

daily.description: The resource URI for fetching daily usage records.

last_month.description: The resource URI for fetching usage records for the last month.

description.description: A brief explanation or summary of the usage record data.

end_date.description: The end date of the usage record period.

usage_unit.description: The unit of measurement for the usage field, corresponding to the usage count unit.

price.description: The total price incurred for the consumed units in the usage record.

uri.description: The unique resource identifier for the usage record.

account_sid.description: The unique identifier for the account associated with the usage record.

usage.description: The total usage value, which could be a cumulative count or a sum of values depending on the category.

start_date.description: The start date and time of the usage record period.

count_unit.description: The unit of measurement for the count field, such as minutes, messages, or bytes.

as_of.description: The timestamp indicating the date and time up to which the usage data is accurate.

api_version.description: The version of the Twilio API used in the interaction that generated the usage record.
